title: Cash Register
description: Mobile‑first POS for restaurants and bars.
subtitle: Modern Point of Sale System
overview: A web‑based POS that streamlines ordering with an interface tuned for touch and small screens.

coreConcept.summary: Born from the need to use the app at a rural event I helped organize.
bullets: Evolved iteratively during the event where it was used
Ensures easy access by being available online

features: Catalog split into drink and food categories with prices for each product
Cart with add/remove functionality and quantity adjustments
On mobile, a floating cart that makes it easy to jump between the last added item and the cart
Order history with timestamps, order details, and real-time updates

frontendStack: Next.js 15 with App Router and static export capability
projectStructure: Supabase backend with PostgreSQL, typed schema, and RLS
Type-safe DB operations with generated types
Modular UI in /components/ui and business logic in /lib
Key components: CashRegister, FloatingCartButton, OrderList, OrderDetails
deployment: Built and published via GitLab Pipelines

personalExperience:
Cash Register was born out of necessity during a rural event I helped organize. The challenge of building a functional POS system in under 8 hours was intense but incredibly educational. Working under time pressure forced me to make quick architectural decisions and prioritize features that would actually be used.

The iterative development during the event itself was a unique experience - I was able to see real users interact with the system and make improvements on the fly. The floating cart feature for mobile was a direct result of watching people struggle with the initial design.

This project taught me the value of simplicity, rapid iteration, and building for real-world constraints. Using Supabase for real-time updates was crucial, and seeing orders appear instantly across multiple devices was satisfying. It's a great example of how constraints can lead to creative solutions.
